(5)  Permit a dwelling unit governed by this chapter to be occupied only by persons who do not have a right of possession and violate the minimum standards of this chapter; or 
(6)  Permit a dwelling unit governed by this chapter to exist in a dangerously damaged or deteriorated condition or in a condition likely to endanger a person's property. 
(Ord. No. 2879, 12-11-06) 
Sec. 26-14. - Penalty. 
    The fire chief or building official may take any means necessary to render compliance with the code. It shall be unlawful for any person to violate or fail to comply with provisions of this Code shall be punished by a fine not exceeding five hundred dollars ($500.00) or imprisonment for a term not exceeding sixty (60) days or by both such fine and imprisonment within the discretion of the court. Each day any violation of any provision of this Code shall constitutes a separate offense. Any such person violating any of the provisions of this code shall become liable to the city for any. 
    Expense, loss, or damage occasioned the city by reason of such violation. Where no specific penalty thereof exist in this Code, the violation of any provision shall be punishable as herein set forth. 
(Ord. No. 2879, 12-11-06) 
Chapter 27 - LARGE VOLUME COMMERCIAL AND INDUSTRIAL NATURAL GAS USERS 

Sec. 27-1. - Purpose. 
    To establish monthly rates for large volume commercial and industrial gas users, to provide additional terms and conditions whereby the city will provide natural gas service to such users and to provide for an effective date, and to provide for other matters relating to the subject. 
(Ord. No. 2928, 7-27-09) 
Sec. 27-2. - Definitions. 
    Additional charges shall mean the additional charges set forth under Schedule 2 at the end of this chapter. 
    Adequate assurance deposit amount shall mean, with respect to an LVU, any amount required to be provided by LVU (or LVU's guarantor) or, on or on behalf of LVU (or LVU's guarantor), as adequate assurance of performance pursuant to section 27-12. The adequate assurance deposit amount shall be funded with: (i) a cash payment by LVU (or LVU's guarantor) in U.S. dollars; and/or (ii) a letter of credit from a qualified institution. For purposes of valuing adequate assurance of performance on each valuation date, the adequate assurance deposit amount shall be the actual face value of any cash collateral and/or an amount equal to the letter of credit valuation percentage times the undrawn portion of any letter of credit. 
    Adequate assurance of performance shall mean (i) with respect to (A) an LVU with a minimum credit rating or (B) an LVU's guarantor with a minimum credit rating which has executed a guaranty acceptable to city, an adequate assurance deposit amount equal to the positive difference, if any, obtained by subtracting the applicable adequate assurance threshold amount under Schedule 1 at the end of this chapter from the adequate assurance valuation amount, (ii) with respect to an LVU or LVU's guarantor which does not have a minimum credit rating, such LVU's adequate assurance threshold amount shall be $0.00 and its adequate assurance deposit amount shall be equal to the adequate assurance valuation amount; or (iii) with respect to (A) an LVU or LVU's guarantor which fails to make any two (2) payments within any twelve-month period on or before the applicable date for payment as provided for under a contract or (B) an LVU or LVU's guarantor which has caused or permitted to occur an event of default under section 27-12 or a default under section 27-12, such LVU's adequate assurance threshold amount shall be $0.00 and its adequate assurance deposit amount shall be equal to the adequate assurance valuation amount. 
    Adequate assurance threshold amount(s) shall have the meaning as set forth under Schedule 1 at the end of this chapter. 
    Adequate assurance valuation amount shall be the amount calculated by city for an LVU pursuant to section 27-12 as of the date set forth in the demand made by city for such adequate assurance of performance, and thereafter the amount calculated by city pursuant to section 27-12 on each valuation date, and shall be equal to the sum of the following: 
(1)  Value of two-months' supply of gas based on the ordinance price then in effect under the monthly rate for the contract quantity; 
(2)  Amount equal to capacity charges under the monthly rate for the delivery of a quantity of gas equal to the contract quantity for two (2) months; and 
(3)  Amount equal to any additional charges under the monthly rate for delivery of a quantity of gas equal to the contract quantity for two (2) months as reasonably required by the city. For purposes of determining the contract quantity under this definition of adequate assurance valuation amount, any reductions in the contract quantity under section 27-5 shall not be taken into account. 
    Affiliate shall mean, with respect to any person, any other person (other than an individual) that, directly or indirectly, through one (1) or more intermediaries, controls, or is controlled by, or is under common control with, such person. For purposes of the foregoing definition, "control" shall mean, with respect to entities with outstanding capital stock or other equity interests having ordinary voting power, the direct or indirect ownership of more than fifty (50) percent of the outstanding capital stock or other equity interests having ordinary voting power. 
    British thermal unit or Btu shall mean the international Btu, which is also called the Btu (IT). 
    Business day shall mean any day excluding (a) Saturday, Sunday and any day on which banks located in the State of New York are required or authorized by law or other governmental action to close, and (b) any day on which the New York Mercantile Exchange or the qualified institution designated by city under section 27-12 is closed. 
    Capacity charges shall mean the capacity charges set forth under Schedule 2 at the end of this chapter. 
    City shall mean the City of Gonzales, State of Louisiana. 
    Contract shall mean the legally-binding relationship established between city and an LVU by: 
(1)  This chapter; and 
(2)  The respective local services agreement between city and such LVU, whereby this chapter and the local services agreement together shall form a single integrated agreement between city and such LVU. 
    Contract quantity shall mean, with respect to an LVU, the quantity of gas to be delivered and taken pursuant to the service option selected such LVU under its gas utility service application and as further agreed to by the parties under part 5 of the applicable local services agreement. 
    Contract year shall mean each period from January 1 of a calendar year to and including December 31 of such calendar year. 
    Cover standard, as referred to in section 27-7, shall mean that if there is an unexcused failure to take or deliver any quantity of gas pursuant to a contract, then the performing party shall use commercially reasonable efforts to: 
(1)  If LVU is the performing party, obtain gas (or an alternate fuel if elected by LVU and replacement gas is not available); or 
(2)  If city is the performing party, sell gas, in either case, at a price reasonable for the delivery or production area, as applicable, consistent with: the amount of notice provided by the nonperforming party; the immediacy of LVU's gas consumption needs or city's gas sales requirements, as applicable; the quantities involved; and the anticipated length of failure by the nonperforming party. 
    Credit rating shall mean a rating currently assigned to a party's unsecured and senior long-term debt (not supported by third-party credit enhancement) by Moody's or S&P. In the event of a split rating the lower shall prevail. 
    Day shall mean a period of twenty-four (24) consecutive hours, beginning at midnight on a calendar day and ending immediately before midnight on the next succeeding calendar day. 
    Delivery period shall mean, with respect to a local services agreement, the period during which deliveries are to be made as agreed to by the parties under such local services agreement. 
    Delivery point shall mean, with respect to a local services agreement, each such point as is agreed to by the parties under such local services agreement. 
    Event of default shall have the meaning as set forth under section 27-12. 
    Firm shall mean that either party may interrupt its performance without liability only to the extent that such performance is prevented for reasons of force majeure; provided, however, that during force majeure interruptions, each party shall be obligated to make certain payments as provided for under section 27-13, including, but not limited to, imbalance charges as set forth in section 27-8 for which the party invoking force majeure may be responsible related to such party's interruption after the nomination is made to the transporter and until a change in deliveries and/or receipts is confirmed by the transporter. 
    Force majeure shall have the meaning as set forth under section 27-13. 
    Gas shall mean any mixture of hydrocarbons and noncombustible gases in a gaseous state consisting primarily of ethane. 
    Gas utility service application shall mean that document, which shall include the local services agreement, whereby an LVU applies for gas service from city and selects its desired option for service from those provided in the application form. The form of such gas utility service application is attached to Ordinance No. 2928 as Exhibit "A" and incorporated fully herein. 
    Guarantor shall mean, with respect to an LVU, any entity that is an affiliate of such LVU and has provided a guaranty of the payment obligations of such LVU under a contract. 
    Imbalance charges shall mean any fees, penalties, costs or charges (in cash or in kind) assessed by a transporter for failure to satisfy the transporter's balance and/or nomination requirements. 
    Index price shall mean, with respect to an LVU, the price set forth under part 4 of the applicable local services agreement. 
    Large volume commercial and industrial user or LVU shall mean a retail gas customer whose business shall be involved either in the commercial purchase or sale of goods or the manufacture or processing of products for sale or resale and which has been approved for gas service by city pursuant to section 27-4 and has entered into a local services agreement for gas service with city. 
    Letter of credit shall mean an irrevocable, transferable, standby letter of credit, issued by a qualified institution utilizing a form as may be acceptable to city and its counsel. 
    Letter of credit default shall mean with respect to an outstanding letter of credit, the occurrence of any of the following events: 
(1)  The issuer of such letter of credit shall fail to maintain a credit rating of at least "A-" by S&P or "A3" by Moody's; 
(2)  The issuer of the letter of credit shall fail to comply with or perform its obligations under such letter of credit if such failure shall be continuing after the lapse of any applicable grace period; 
(3)  The issuer of such letter of credit shall disaffirm, disclaim, repudiate or reject, in whole or in part, or challenge the validity of, such letter of credit; 
(4)  Such letter of credit shall expire or terminate, or shall fail or cease to be in full force and effect at any time during the term of the relevant contract; or 
(5)  Any event analogous to an event specified in section 27-12 shall occur with respect to the issuer of such letter of credit; provided, however, that no letter of credit default shall occur in any event with respect to a letter of credit after the time such letter of credit is required to be canceled or returned to LVU in accordance with the terms of the relevant contract. 
    Letter of credit valuation percentage shall mean one hundred (100) percent of the undrawn portion of the letter of credit unless (i) a letter of credit default shall apply with respect to such letter of credit, or (ii) twenty (20) or fewer business days remain prior to the expiration of such letter of credit, in either of which case the letter of credit valuation percentage shall be zero (0). 
    Local services agreement shall mean the local services agreement, by and between city and an LVU required by Section 1326(A)(1)(a) of the Local Services Law, Part VII, Subpart A of Title 33 of the Louisiana Revised Statutes of 1950, as amended, as such local services agreement may be amended from time to time pursuant to the provisions thereof, whereby city agrees to provide gas service to such LVU pursuant to the contract and such LVU agrees to accept gas service pursuant to the provisions of its respective contract. The form of the local services agreement is attached to Ordinance No. 2928 as Exhibit "B" and incorporated fully herein. 
    LVU discount shall be, as referred to in Exhibit "A" to the gas utility service application, with respect to each service option set forth in the gas utility service application, the discount as set forth under each respective service option and as further agreed to by parties under a local services agreement. LVU discount shall be subject to adjustments in accordance with the provisions of Schedule 2 at the end of this chapter under the heading "Adjustments to LVU Discount and Ordinance Price." 
    LVU ordinance utility fund shall be the fund of city established pursuant to section 27-6. 
    LVU plant shall mean, with respect to an LVU, the LVU plant identified by such LVU under its gas utility service application and as further agreed to by the parties under part 9 of the applicable local services agreement. 
    Market disruption event shall mean, with respect to an index, any of the following events: 
(1)  The failure of the index to announce or publish information necessary for determining the applicable index price; 
(2)  The failure of trading to commence or the permanent discontinuation or material suspension of trading in the relevant options contract or commodity on the exchange or market acting as the index; 
(3)  The temporary or permanent discontinuance or unavailability of the index; 
(4)  The temporary or permanent closing of any exchange acting as the index; or 
(5)  A material change in the formula for or the method of determining the applicable index price. 
    Minimum credit rating shall mean a credit rating no lower than Baa3 by Moody's or no lower than BBB- by S&P. In the event of a split rating the lower shall prevail. For clarity, a party shall not have a minimum credit rating if it has a credit rating of below Baa3 by Moody's or below BBB- by S&P. 
    MMBtu shall mean one million British thermal units, which is equivalent to one dekatherm. 
    Month or monthly shall mean a period beginning at 9:00 a.m. central time on the first day of a calendar month and ending immediately preceding 9:00 a.m. central time on the first day of the next succeeding calendar month. If, through standardizing business practices in the industry, or for any other reason, either F.E.R.C. or transporter(s) change the definition of month, such change shall apply to the definition of month in this chapter; provided that in the event a transporter changes the definition of a month as applicable to the delivery of gas hereunder, the definition of month herein shall be changed only with respect to gas delivered through such transporter. 
    Monthly rates shall have the meaning as set forth in section 27-2, shall be as provided for in Schedule 2 at the end of this chapter, and shall be subject to any changes in such monthly rates as may be provided for under the terms and conditions set forth under Schedule 2 at the end of this chapter, including but not limited to, adjustments or changes in accordance with the provisions of Schedule 2 at the end of this chapter under the heading "Adjustments to LVU Discount and Ordinance Price." 
    Moody's shall mean Moody's Investor Services, Inc. or its successor. 
    Notice or notices shall have the meaning as set forth under part 12 to the local services agreement. 
    Ordinance agreements shall mean all agreements executed by city in connection with providing gas service hereunder or in connection with or relating to city acquiring or delivering gas supplies used to provide gas service hereunder including, but not limited to, each contract, any agreement with gas suppliers providing gas to be used by city to provide gas service under the provisions of this chapter, any agreement with a transporter or other third party providing for the delivery of gas pursuant to section 27-8, each local services agreement, any agreement providing for remarketing of gas supplies relating to gas service hereunder and any other agreement with a third party providing for administrative, accounting or other related services in connection with providing gas service under this chapter. An executed copy of each ordinance agreement shall be maintained on file with city. 
    Ordinance expenses shall mean fees, payments and other expenses incurred or otherwise payable under the ordinance agreements which are incurred by city in connection with city providing gas service to LVUs hereunder, or in connection with or relating to city acquiring or delivering gas supplies used to provide gas service hereunder or any other amounts payable by city in connection therewith. 
    Ordinance price shall mean, with respect to an LVU, the amount expressed in U.S. dollars per MMBtu to be paid by such LVU to city for the purchase of gas pursuant to the service option selected by such LVU under its gas utility service application and as further agreed to by the parties under a local services agreement. The ordinance price may be adjusted or changed in accordance with the provisions of Schedule 2 at the end of this chapter under the heading "Adjustments to LVU Discount and Ordinance Price." 
    Ordinance revenues shall mean all amounts received by city under the ordinance agreements which are received by city in connection with city providing gas service to LVUs hereunder or in connection with or relating to city acquiring or delivering gas supplies used to provide gas service hereunder, or any other amounts received by city in connection therewith, together with any interest received on any moneys or securities required to be paid into the LVU ordinance utility fund. 
    Payment date shall mean 25 th day of the month following month of delivery of gas or, if such day is not a business day, the next succeeding business day. 
    Permitted investments shall mean the investments as set forth under Schedule 3 at the end of this chapter. 
    Qualified institution shall mean a U.S. commercial bank or a foreign bank with a U.S. branch office which is not an LVU (or affiliate of an LVU) having assets of at least 10 billion dollars ($10,000,000,000.00) which has a credit rating of at least "A-" by S&P or "A3" by Moody's. 
    S&P shall mean the Standard & Poor's rating services (a division of McGraw-Hill, Inc.) or its successor. 
    Scheduled gas shall mean the quantity of gas confirmed by transporter(s) for movement, transportation or management. 
    Spot price shall mean, with respect to gas for the relevant day provided for under section 27-7, the "daily midpoint" price set forth in Gas Daily (published by Platt's Inside FERC's Gas Market Report) for such day, or any successor publication, in the column "Daily Price Survey" under the listing applicable to the geographic location closest in proximity to the delivery point applicable to the index price. If there is no single "daily midpoint" price published for such location for such day, but there is published a range of prices, then the spot price shall be the average of such high and low prices. If no price or range of prices is published for such day, then the spot price shall be the average of the following: 
(1)  The price (determined as stated above) for the first day for which a price or range of prices is published that next precedes the relevant day; and 
(2)  The price (determined as stated above) for the first day for which a price or range of prices is published that next follows the relevant day. 
    Transporter(s) shall mean, with respect to an LVU, all gas gathering or pipeline companies, or local distribution companies, acting in the capacity of a transporter, transporting gas for city to the delivery point pursuant to such LVU's local services agreement. 
    Valuation date(s) shall mean the first business day of each month or any day on which a change in the credit rating of an LVU or an LVU's guarantor would result in an adjustment in adequate assurance of performance. 
(Ord. No. 2928, 7-27-09) 
Sec. 27-3. - Monthly rates. 
    There shall be and there are hereby established for the use of LVU customers, located both inside and outside the corporate limits of city, the monthly rates and charges (the "monthly rates") for gas service provided by the gas utility of city as set forth in Schedule 2 at the end of this chapter, which are hereby deemed to be reasonable, equitable, and based on cost of providing gas service and reasonably calculated to provide for revenue requirements of the gas utility of city necessary to meet the ongoing budgetary requirements of the gas utility of city. 
(Ord. No. 2928, 7-27-09) 
Sec. 27-4. - Application. 
    Each applicant for gas service pursuant to a contract with city shall submit a gas utility service application to city. All applicants meeting the requirements of this chapter will be eligible for gas service under the terms and conditions hereof. However, city has a limited gas supply and city shall have no obligation to approve any application hereunder and enter into any local services agreement if city does not have sufficient gas supply. The gas utility service application shall be considered by city after submission by the applicant and, if granted, gas service shall be provided pursuant to a contract. City may approve a gas utility service application of an LVU and agree to provide gas service subject to gas being available to city at a later date and subject to city and LVU entering into a local services agreement for such service. An applicant being provided gas service under a contract entered into pursuant to this chapter may make application for additional gas service by submitting a supplement to its gas utility service application, and upon approval by city consistent with the requirements of this section 27-4, city and LVU may enter into an amendment to its local services agreement (or a separate local services agreement) to provide for additional gas service by city. The applicant shall also be required to enter into a local services agreement with city at such time it enters into the local services agreement. 
(Ord. No. 2928, 7-27-09) 
Sec. 27-5. - Performance obligation and contract quantity. 
    City shall agree to provide gas service to each LVU subject to the terms and conditions set forth under the applicable contract. In accordance therewith, city shall agree to sell and deliver, and the applicable LVU shall agree to receive and purchase, the contract quantity set forth under the contract. Sales and purchases will be on a firm basis, subject to the terms and conditions under this section 27-5. 
In the event an LVU determines that its gas requirements at the LVU plant will be less than the contract quantity for any month, LVU may reduce the contract quantity to equal LVU's requirements for such month by notice to city of such reduced contract quantity no later than forty-five (45) days (or such other notice period as agreed to by city and the applicable LVU) prior to the first day of the applicable month, and such reduced contract quantity will be the applicable contract quantity for such month. To be eligible for this reduction, LVU shall provide such affidavit or certificate as city may reasonably require to support the need for the reduction in gas requirements at its LVU plant and the quantity of such reductions. In determining any reduction in its gas requirements at the LVU plant for a month pursuant to this section 27-5, an LVU shall first allocate gas to be delivered under this chapter for use at the LVU plant for such month before taking into account any other LVU gas supplies. 
Each LVU will have the right, upon ninety (90) days' notice to city (or such other notice period as agreed to by city and LVU), to terminate its obligations under its contract prior to the end of the delivery period without liability to either city or LVU under section 27-7 in the event that LVU permanently shuts down and ceases operation of its LVU plant; provided, however, with respect to the contract quantity to be delivered and received under the contract through the date of termination under this section 27-5, the parties shall pay all amounts owed there under and all other applicable charges relating to gas service under the contract (including any amounts owed under section 27-8). Further, LVU shall be responsible to reimburse city for all applicable transportation fees and charges paid or to be paid for the right to transport the originally agreed contract quantity to LVU's delivery point regardless of the operation of the LVU plant as provided for under capacity charges under Schedule 2 at the end of this chapter. To be eligible for termination under the provisions of this section 27-5, an LVU shall provide such affidavit or certificate as city may reasonably require whereby LVU certifies that it will shut down and cease operations of its LVU plant. To meet the requirement for a permanent shut down under this section 27-5, LVU must certify that the LVU plant shall be shut down and cease operations for at least one (1) year after the relevant termination date. 
In accordance with the provisions of Schedule 2 at the end of this chapter under the heading "Adjustments to LVU Discount and Ordinance Price," city, from time to time, may provide for adjustments to the LVU discount and the ordinance price. Each LVU will have the right, upon forty-five (45) days' notice to city (or such other notice period as agreed to by city and LVU), to terminate its obligations under its contract prior to the end of the delivery period without liability to either city or LVU under section 27-8 in the event that city adjusts its rates and charges for gas service as provided for under Schedule 2 at the end of this chapter under the heading "Adjustments to LVU Discount and Ordinance Price" and as a result thereof, the originally agreed LVU discount as set forth under part 4 of the local services agreement is reduced by an amount greater than six cents ($0.06); provided, however, with respect to the contract quantity to be delivered and received under the contract through the date of termination under this section 27-5, the parties shall pay all amounts owed there under and all other applicable charges relating to gas service under the contract and the ordinance agreements (including any amounts owed under section 27-7). Further, LVU shall be responsible to reimburse city for all applicable transportation fees and charges paid or to be paid by city for the right to transport the originally agreed contract quantity to LVU's delivery point as provided for under capacity charges under Schedule 2 at the end of this chapter. To be eligible for termination under the provisions of this section 27-5, LVU must provide its notice to terminate pursuant to this section 27-5 within fifteen (15) days after receipt of city's notice of adjustments to LVU discount and ordinance price provided by city pursuant to the provisions of Schedule 2 at the end of this chapter under the heading "Adjustments to LVU Discount and Ordinance Price." 
(Ord. No. 2928, 7-27-09) 
Sec. 27-6. - Limited obligation of city. 
    City's obligation to make any payments required to be made by it under any contract shall be a special and limited obligation of city payable solely from amounts in the LVU ordinance utility fund. City shall establish a separate fund as the LVU ordinance utility fund and shall deposit into the LVU ordinance utility fund all ordinance revenues. Amounts within such LVU ordinance utility fund will be used first to pay ordinance expenses then due and owing and second to pay any other expenditures as permitted by law consistent with the provisions of city's gas utility budget which may include, but not be limited to administrative costs, professional fees, repair and replacements to the city's gas utility, security, fire protection and such other costs and expenses as may be approved in the city's budgetary process; provided, however, each LVU's adequate assurance deposit amount shall only be deposited into the applicable LVU adequate assurance fund and invested and applied in accordance with the provisions of section 27-12. Any amounts on deposit in the LVU ordinance utility fund shall be invested in permitted investments. Any investment earnings on amounts deposited in the LVU ordinance utility fund shall be retained therein and expended in accordance with the provisions of this section 27-6. City may establish separate sub-funds or accounts within the LVU ordinance utility fund. 
The obligations of city under this chapter or any contract do not constitute a pledge of the full faith and credit of city within the meaning of any constitutional or statutory provision or limitation but rather city's obligations under this chapter or any contract are special and limited obligations of city payable solely from the LVU ordinance utility fund. The obligations of city under this chapter or any contract are not a general obligation of city but are a special and limited obligation of city payable solely from the LVU ordinance utility fund. Notwithstanding any amendment, supplement, default, remedy, termination or any other event or transaction under (a) any contract to provide gas service hereunder, (b) any agreement between city and its gas suppliers to supply, transport or otherwise deliver gas to be used by city to provide gas service under any contract, or (c) any other ordinance agreement with a third party with respect to city transporting, delivering or otherwise providing gas service hereunder, each LVU's recourse against city under a contract, or otherwise, for city's failure to make any payments under a contract shall be limited to amounts on deposit in the LVU ordinance utility fund. 
(Ord. No. 2928, 7-27-09) 
Sec. 27-7. - Failure to deliver or receive gas. 
    Subject to the provisions of the immediately succeeding section, the sole and exclusive remedy of city and each LVU under a contract in the event of a breach of an obligation to deliver or receive gas under the terms and conditions of section 27-5 and under the terms and conditions of the local services agreement shall be recovery of the following: 
(1)  In the event of a breach by city on any day(s), payment by city to the respective LVU in an amount equal to the positive difference, if any, between the purchase price paid by LVU utilizing the cover standard and the contract price, adjusted for any additional transportation and related charges as a result of breach by city, multiplied by the difference between the contract quantity and the quantity actually delivered by city for such day(s) excluding any quantity for which no replacement is obtained; or 
(2)  In the event of a breach by LVU on any day(s), payment by LVU to city in the amount equal to the positive difference, if any, between the index price and the price received by city utilizing the cover standard for the resale of such gas, adjusted for any additional transportation and related charges incurred as a result of breach by LVU (including any applicable capacity charges and/or additional charges), multiplied by the difference between the contract quantity and the quantity actually taken by LVU for such day(s) excluding any quantity for which no cover standard sale is made; and 
(3)  In the event that LVU has used commercially reasonable efforts to replace the gas or city has used commercially reasonable efforts to sell the gas to a third party, and no such replacement or sale is made for all or any portion of the contract quantity of gas, then in addition to (1) or (2) above, as applicable, the sole and exclusive remedy of the performing party with respect to the gas not replaced or sold shall be an amount equal to any unfavorable difference between the contract price and the spot price in the event of a claim by LVU for city's breach of its obligation to deliver gas, or between the index price and the spot price in the event of a claim by city for LVU's breach of its obligation to purchase gas, as adjusted for any transportation and related charges (including with respect to LVU any capacity charges and/or additional charges), multiplied by the quantity of such gas not replaced or sold. Imbalance charges shall not be recovered under this section 27-7, but city and/or LVU shall be responsible for imbalance charges, if any, as provided in section 27-8. The amount of such unfavorable difference shall be payable as provided in section 27-10. 
    Notwithstanding the provisions of subsection (3), with respect to an event of default by LVU under section 27-12 or with respect to an event of default by city under section 27-12, the non-defaulting party shall have the right to exercise all remedies as provided for under section 27-12. 
(Ord. No. 2928, 7-27-09) 
Sec. 27-8. - Transportation, nominations, and imbalances. 
    In providing gas service under this chapter, city shall have the responsibility for transporting the gas to the delivery point and may contract with one (1) or more transporters for this function. Transporting gas to the delivery point shall be controlled by city. City may contract with one (1) or more third parties to perform services necessary to deliver gas to delivery point(s) under the provisions of this chapter including, but not limited to, arrangements for transportation, nominations, scheduling, balancing, confirmations, storage, gas remarketing and other delivery and/or load management services. Title to the gas shall pass from city to LVU at the delivery point, and LVU shall have the sole responsibility for distribution and delivery of the gas from the delivery point. The parties recognize and agree that city has no responsibility or liability for distribution or delivery of gas by LVU, or on behalf of LVU by third parties, from the delivery point, or on LVU system, and that LVU shall make city whole for any financial costs incurred by city caused by or resulting from such distribution or delivery. Each LVU acknowledges and agrees that gas purchased by such LVU from city under the provisions of this chapter will be consumed by LVU at the LVU plant as provided under part 9 of each local services agreement. Upon written request by an LVU, city shall provide to LVU copies of agreements which city has executed with transporters to provide for transportation and delivery of gas under the contract with LVU to the relevant delivery point. LVU may make recommendations to city with respect to any proposed transportation arrangements providing for transportation and delivery of gas under the contract with LVU to the relevant delivery point. City and LVU shall use commercially reasonable efforts to communicate periodically and consistently with one another to discuss LVU's recommendations and other alternatives with respect to transportation and delivery of gas under the contract with LVU to the relevant delivery point. Provided, however, city, in its sole discretion, may accept or reject any such LVU recommendations or proposed transportation and delivery alternatives as city shall retain control for transporting gas to the relevant delivery point and have responsibility for transporting gas to the relevant delivery point consistent with the provisions of this section 27-8. 
In the event of an amendment, supplement, modification or termination with respect to (1) any agreement with any transporter, or (2) any agreement with city's gas suppliers which will result in any curtailment in city providing for delivery of gas under a contract with an LVU, city shall provide notice of such event to such relevant LVU. 
The parties shall coordinate with respect to city's nomination activities, giving sufficient time to meet the deadlines of the affected transporter(s). Each party shall give the other party timely prior notice, sufficient to meet the requirements of all transporter(s) involved in the transaction, of the quantities of gas to be delivered and purchased each day. Should either party become aware that actual deliveries at the delivery point are greater or lesser than the scheduled gas, such party shall promptly notify the other party. 
The parties shall use commercially reasonable efforts to avoid imposition of any imbalance charges. If city receives an invoice from a transporter that includes imbalance charges with respect to a contract with an LVU, the parties shall determine the validity as well as the cause of such imbalance charges. If the imbalance charges were incurred as a result of LVU's actions or inactions, then LVU shall pay city the amount of such imbalance charges or if applicable, reimburse city for such imbalance charges paid by city. If the imbalance charges were incurred as a result of city's actions or inactions, then city shall pay for such imbalance charges. 
(Ord. No. 2928, 7-27-09) 
Sec. 27-9. - Quality and measurement. 
    All gas delivered by city shall conform to the pressure, quality and heat content requirements of the transporter. The unit of quantity measurement for purposes of this chapter shall be one (1) MMBtu dry. Gas sold under this contract shall be measured through transporter's existing measurement facilities at the delivery point in accordance with provisions of transporter's applicable FERC gas tariff and the measurement standards and procedures in any applicable transportation agreement between city and transporter. 
(Ord. No. 2928, 7-27-09) 
Sec. 27-10. - Billing, payment, and audit. 
    City or a third party acting on behalf of city, shall invoice each LVU on or before the fifteenth (15 th ) day of each month at rates and charges for gas service in accordance with the monthly rates included in Schedule 2 at the end of this chapter for gas delivered and received hereunder in the preceding month and for any other applicable charges (including capacity charges, additional charges and any other charges under the monthly rate). If requested by an LVU, city shall provide supporting documentation acceptable in industry practice to support the amount charged. If the actual quantity delivered is not known by the billing date, billing will be prepared based on the quantity of scheduled gas. The invoiced quantity will then be adjusted to the actual quantity on the following month's billing or as soon thereafter as actual delivery information is available. LVU shall remit the amount due under section 27-10 in the manner specified in the contract, in immediately available funds to be paid in U.S. dollars, on or before the later of (1) the payment date or (2) ten (10) days after receipt of the invoice by LVU; provided that if the later of (1) or (2) immediately above is not a business day, payment is due on the next business day following that date. In the event any payments are due LVU hereunder, payment to LVU shall be made in a manner consistent with this section 27-10. LVU shall remit the amount due in immediately available funds to be paid on or before 10:00 a.m. central time on the relevant date for payment as provided under this section 27-10. In the event any payment becomes due pursuant to section 27-7, the performing party may submit an invoice to the nonperforming party setting forth the basis upon which the invoiced amount was calculated. Payment from the nonperforming party will be due on the next applicable date for payment as provided for under section 27-10. 
If the invoiced party, in good faith, disputes the amount of any such invoice or any part thereof, such invoiced party will pay such amount as it concedes to be correct; provided, however, if the invoiced party disputes the amount due, it must provide supporting documentation acceptable in industry practice to support the amount paid or disputed without undue delay. In the event the parties are unable to resolve such dispute, either party may pursue any remedy available at law or in equity to enforce its rights pursuant to the contract. 
If the invoiced party fails to remit the full amount payable when due, interest on the unpaid portion shall accrue from the date due until the date of payment at a rate equal to the lower of: 
(1)  The then-effective prime rate of interest published under "Money Rates" by the Wall Street Journal, plus two (2) percent per annum; or 
(2)  The maximum applicable lawful interest rate. 
In addition, if an LVU fails to remit the full amount payable when due under section 27-10 for rates and charges invoiced by city each month under section 27-10, then LVU shall pay a late payment fee equal to the product of: 
(1)  The contract quantity under the contract for a month; and 
(2)  The ratio of the unpaid amount over the total amount billed to LVU under the contract for such month, multiplied by twenty cents ($0.20) per MMBtu. 
Provided, however, in the event that city exercises its right to set off any adequate assurance deposit amount against any amount due and owing by such LVU to city pursuant to the provisions of section 27-12, city shall assess a late payment fee in a reduced amount equal to the product of: 
(1)  The contract quantity under the contract for a month; and 
(2)  The ratio of the unpaid amount over the total amount billed to LVU under the contract for such month, multiplied by five cents ($0.05) per MMBtu. 
A late payment fee shall be assessed by city against LVU for each failure by LVU to make the applicable monthly payment when due under section 27-10. In the event any late payment fee becomes due from an LVU pursuant to this section 27-10, city shall submit an invoice to such LVU setting forth the basis upon which the late payment fee was calculated. payment from LVU will be due on the next applicable date for payment as provided for under section 27-10. 
(Ord. No. 2928, 7-27-09) 
Sec. 27-11. - Title and warranty. 
    Title to the gas shall pass from city to LVU at the delivery point. City shall have responsibility for and assume any liability with respect to the gas prior to its delivery to LVU at the specified delivery point. LVU shall have responsibility for and assume any liability with respect to said gas after its delivery to LVU at the delivery point. 
City warrants that it will have the right to convey and will transfer good and merchantable title to all gas sold hereunder and delivered by it to LVU, free and clear of all liens, encumbrances, and claims. Except as provided in this section 27-11 and in part 13.10 of each local services agreement, all other warranties, express or implied, including any warranty of merchantability or of fitness for any particular purpose, are disclaimed. 
Notwithstanding the other provisions of this section 27-11, as between city and LVU, city will be liable for all claims to the extent that such claims arise from the failure of gas delivered by city to meet the quality requirements of section 27-9. 
(Ord. No. 2928, 7-27-09) 
Sec. 27-12. - Financial responsibility. 
    Upon execution of a local services agreement, LVU or LVU's guarantor shall provide adequate assurance of performance reasonably acceptable to city. Throughout the term of a contract, LVU or LVU's guarantor shall maintain adequate assurance of performance at all times. The initial adequate assurance of performance shall be as provided for in part 13.9 of the local services agreement. As provided for under section 27-12, city may designate a qualified institution(s) to act as a custodian and fiduciary on behalf of city with respect to depositing, investing and/or applying adequate assurance of performance under the provisions of this chapter. Such funds may only be invested in the permitted investments set forth in Schedule 3 at the end of this chapter. LVU hereby grants to city, or city's designee, a continuing first priority security interest in, lien on, and right of setoff against all adequate assurance of performance transferred by LVU to city or city's designee. Upon the return by city (or city's designee) to LVU of any adequate assurance of performance, the security interest and lien granted hereunder on that adequate assurance performance shall be released automatically and, to the extent possible, without any further action by either party. 
If at any time (1) LVU or LVU's guarantor fails to make any two (2) payments within any twelve-month period on or before the applicable date for payment as provided for under a contract, or (2) LVU or LVU's guarantor has caused or permitted to occur an event of default under section 27-12 or a default under section 27-12, city may demand adequate assurance of performance which shall be an adequate assurance deposit amount equal to the adequate assurance valuation amount. Within one (1) business day after such demand is made by city to LVU, LVU shall provide adequate assurance of performance which shall be an adequate assurance deposit amount provided by LVU to city (or city's designee) in an amount equal to the adequate assurance valuation amount. 
City shall have the right, in its sole discretion, to set off against any adequate assurance deposit amount provided by LVU any amounts due and owing by such LVU under the terms of a contract including, but not limited to, any amounts due and owing by such LVU under section 27-10 and section 27-12. Within one (1) business day after city exercises its right to set off under this section 27-12 and applies funds from LVU's adequate assurance deposit amount against any amounts due and owing by such LVU under the terms of the contract, city, or a third party acting on behalf of city, shall provide notice to LVU which shall include the amount that LVU shall be required to provide to city (or its designee) so that the adequate assurance of performance shall be replenished. Within one (1) business day after receipt of such notice by LVU, LVU shall provide to city (or city's designee) the amount necessary to replenish the adequate assurance of performance as set forth in such notice provided by city to LVU. 
In the event that (1) LVU or LVU's guarantor with a minimum credit rating has provided adequate assurance of performance pursuant to section 27-12 and thereafter has made all payments under its contract on or before the applicable dates for payment for twelve (12) consecutive months, and (2) such LVU or LVU's guarantor has not caused or permitted to occur an event of default under section 27-12 or a default under section 27-12, then city shall return (or cause its designee to return) to LVU all or a portion of the adequate assurance deposit amount; provided, however, such LVU shall continue to provide and maintain adequate assurance of performance under section 27-12, including any adequate assurance deposit amount provided for under part (1) of the definition of adequate assurance of performance. In the event that LVU subsequently fails to meet the requirements of section 27-12, LVU shall again provide adequate assurance of performance in accordance with the provisions of section 27-12. City (or its designee) shall calculate adequate assurance of performance as of each valuation date and city (or its designee) shall provide LVU a statement within five (5) business days after such valuation date setting forth the adequate assurance valuation amount, the adequate assurance threshold amount, the amount of investment earnings on deposit in the relevant LVU adequate assurance fund, the undrawn portion of any letter of credit, the letter of credit valuation percentage, and the adequate assurance deposit amount. Within one (1) business day after receipt of such statement provided by city, or a third party acting on behalf of city, to LVU under the provisions of this section 27-12, LVU shall provide any additional amounts to city (or its designee) as set forth in such statement so that the adequate assurance deposit amount shall meet the requirements for adequate assurance of performance on such valuation date. To the extent city (or its designee), as of any valuation date, has on deposit amounts (including any investment earnings) in the relevant LVU adequate assurance fund, plus any adequate assurance deposit amount funded with a letter of credit from a qualified institution, in excess of adequate assurance of performance for LVU, such excess shall be returned by city (or its designee) to LVU within one (1) business day after the delivery of the applicable statement by city to LVU. 
For each adequate assurance deposit amount provided by an LVU under this chapter, city (or its designee) shall establish a separate fund or account for each LVU (each such fund or account an "LVU adequate assurance fund") within the LVU ordinance utility fund. City (or its designee) shall make deposits to each LVU adequate assurance fund, invest amounts therein and apply amounts there under consistent with the provisions of this section 27-12. City shall not deposit, invest or apply any amounts within each LVU adequate assurance fund except as provided for under the provisions of this section 27-12. Moneys contained in each LVU adequate assurance fund shall be held by city (or its designee) and shall be continuously invested and reinvested by city (or its designee) in permitted investments, to the extent practicable that shall mature (or be readily convertible to cash) not later than the respective dates, as estimated by city (or its designee), when the moneys in the relevant LVU adequate assurance fund shall be required for the purposes intended. No such investment shall be required to be made unless the cash at the time available therefor is at least equal to one thousand dollars ($1,000.00). City (or its designee) shall be authorized, to the extent necessary to enable city to apply an LVU's adequate assurance of performance in accordance with the of this section 27-12, at any one (1) or more times to sell any part or all of the investments on deposit in such LVU's adequate assurance fund whenever it may, for any reason or purpose whatsoever, deem any such sale to be desirable. Any income derived from any profit or loss on any such investment of moneys on deposit in any such LVU adequate assurance fund shall be credited or debited, as the case may be, to the respective fund or account in which earned. City (or its designee) shall in no event have any liability for any loss resulting from the investment of monies in accordance with the provisions of this section 27-12. On each valuation date, city (or its designee) shall furnish LVU with a written copy of the types, amounts, yield and maturities of all such investments. Investments shall be valued by city (or its designee) as of each valuation date. 
With respect to an LVU which provides a letter of credit from a qualified institution as adequate assurance of performance, upon the occurrence of a letter of credit default, LVU shall deliver to city a substitute letter of credit from a qualified institution or other adequate assurance of performance in an amount at least equal to that of the letter of credit to be substituted on the first business day after written demand by city, with failure by LVU to provide such letter of credit to be deemed to be an event of default under section 27-12. Notwithstanding any provision of the relevant contract, the issuer of a letter of credit shall not be relieved of any liability it may have to any party resulting from the occurrence of a letter of credit default with respect to it. 
City may designate a qualified institution(s) which may act as a custodian and fiduciary on behalf of city with respect to depositing, investing and/or applying adequate assurance of performance in accordance with the provisions of this chapter. In connection therewith, city may contract with such qualified institution(s) with respect to depositing, investing and/or applying adequate assurance deposit amounts in accordance with the provisions of this chapter. 
In the event (each an "event of default") either party (the "defaulting party") or its guarantor shall: 
(1)  Make an assignment or any general arrangement for the benefit of creditors; 
(2)  File a petition or otherwise commence, authorize, or acquiesce in the commencement of a proceeding or case under any bankruptcy or similar law for the protection of creditors or have such petition filed or proceeding commenced against it; 
(3)  Otherwise become bankrupt or insolvent (however evidenced); 
(4)  Be unable to pay its debts as they fall due; 
(5)  Have a receiver, provisional liquidator, conservator custodian, trustee or other similar official appointed with respect to it or substantially all of its assets; 
(6)  Fail to perform any obligation to the other party with respect to any adequate assurance of performance relating to the contract; 
(7)  With respect to LVU (or its guarantor) only, fail to provide and maintain adequate assurance of performance to city (or its designee) under section 27-12 or fail to provide, replenish and/or maintain, as applicable, any adequate assurance deposit amount to city (or its designee) under section 27-12; 
(8)  Not have paid any amount due the other party hereunder on or before the second business day following written notice that such payment is due, including a failure by city to make a payment to LVU as permitted under the provisions of section 27-6 of the chapter; 
(9)  With respect to LVU only, fail to comply with the representations and covenants set forth under part 9 to the local services agreement; 
(10)  For reasons other than (a) force majeure, (b) an event of default by LVU under this section 27-12, or (c) a default by LVU under section 27-12, with respect to city only, fail to deliver to LVU for five (5) consecutive days the contract quantity required to be delivered by city under the relevant contract for such days or fail to deliver to LVU under the relevant contract more than fifty (50) percent of the contract quantity required to be delivered by city on any particular day for fifteen (15) cumulative days during any contract year; 
(11)  For reasons other than (a) force majeure or (b) an event of default by city under this section 27-12, with respect to LVU only, fail to receive from city for five (5) consecutive days the contract quantity required to be received by LVU under the relevant contract for such days, or fail to receive from city more than fifty (50) percent of the contract quantity required to be received by LVU under the relevant contract on any particular day for fifteen (15) cumulative days during any contract year; or 
(12)  With respect to LVU (or LVU's affiliate) only, cause or permit to occur a default or event of default under other contract(s) as set forth under the provisions of part 13.11 of the local services agreement, then the other party (the "non-defaulting party") shall have the right, at its sole election, to immediately withhold and/or suspend deliveries of gas or payments upon notice and/or to terminate and liquidate the transactions under the contract (and terminate the relevant contract) in the manner provided in section 27-12, in addition to any and all other remedies available hereunder; provided, however, that upon the occurrence of an event of default by an LVU described in this section 27-12, city shall immediately withhold and/or suspend deliveries of gas or payments upon notice and/or shall have the right, at its sole election, to terminate and liquidate the transactions under the contract (and terminate the relevant contract) in the manner provided in section 27-12 in addition to all the other remedies available hereunder. 
If an event of default has occurred and is continuing, the non-defaulting party shall have the right, by notice to the defaulting party, to designate a day, no earlier than the day such notice is given and no later than forty (40) days after such notice is given, as an early termination date (the "early termination date") for the liquidation and termination pursuant to section 27-12 of all transactions under such defaulting party's contract (each a "terminated transaction"). On the early termination date, all transactions under such defaulting party's contract will terminate, other than those transactions, if any, that may not be liquidated and terminated under applicable law or that are, in the reasonable opinion of the non-defaulting party, commercially impracticable to liquidate and terminate ("excluded transactions"), which excluded transactions must be liquidated and terminated as soon thereafter as is reasonably practicable, and upon termination each shall be a terminated transaction, and shall be valued consistent with the provisions of section 27-12. With respect to each excluded transaction, its actual termination date shall be the early termination date for purposes of this section 27-12. Except with respect to any excluded transactions which shall be liquidated and terminated in accordance with the provisions of this section 27-12 and subject to the provisions for a subsequent accounting by non-defaulting party to the defaulting party under the provisions of section 27-12, such defaulting party's contract shall also terminate on such early termination date. 
As of the early termination date, the non-defaulting party shall determine, in good faith and in a commercially reasonable manner, the amount owed (whether or not then due) by each party with respect to all gas delivered and received between the parties under terminated transactions and excluded transactions on and before the early termination date and all transportation charges and other applicable charges relating to, such deliveries and receipts (including without limitation any amounts owed under section 27-7), for which payment has not yet been made by the party that owes such payment under the applicable contract. With respect to LVU only, if LVU is the defaulting party, LVU shall reimburse city for all applicable transportation fees and charges paid or to be paid by city for the right to transport the originally agreed contract quantity to LVU's delivery point as provided for under capacity charges under Schedule 2 at the end of this chapter. 
The non-defaulting party shall net or aggregate, as appropriate, any and all amounts owing between the parties under section 27-12, so that all such amounts are netted or aggregated to a single liquidated amount payable by one (1) party to the other (the "net settlement amount"). At its sole option and without prior notice to LVU, city may set off any net settlement amount owed to city by LVU under the contract against any adequate assurance deposit amount held by city (or its designee). 
If the amount of any obligation that is to be included in any netting, aggregation or setoff pursuant to section 27-12 is unascertained, the non-defaulting party may in good faith estimate the amount of that obligation and net, aggregate or setoff, as applicable, in respect of the estimated amount, subject to the non-defaulting party accounting to the defaulting party when the amount of the obligation is ascertained. Any amount not then due which is included in any netting, aggregation or setoff pursuant to section 27-12 shall be discounted to net present value in a commercially reasonable manner determined by the non-defaulting party. 
As soon as practicable after a liquidation, notice shall be given by the non-defaulting party to the defaulting party of the net settlement amount, and whether the net settlement amount is due to or due from the non-defaulting party. The notice shall include a written statement explaining in reasonable detail the calculation of the net settlement amount, provided that failure to give such notice shall not affect the validity or enforceability of the liquidation or give rise to any claim by the defaulting party against the non-defaulting party. The net settlement amount, as adjusted by any setoffs applied against such amount pursuant to section 27-12, shall be paid by the close of business on the second business day following such notice, which date shall not be earlier than the early termination date. Interest on any unpaid portion of the net settlement amount, as adjusted by setoffs, shall accrue from the date due until the date of payment at a rate equal to the lower of: 
(1)  The then-effective prime rate of interest published under "Money Rates" by the Wall Street Journal, plus two (2) percent per annum; or 
(2)  The maximum applicable lawful interest rate. 
The non-defaulting party's remedies under this section 27-12 are the sole and exclusive remedies of the non-defaulting party with respect to the occurrence of any early termination date. Each party reserves to itself all other rights, setoffs, counterclaims and other defenses that it is or may be entitled to arising under the applicable contract. 
Notwithstanding the provisions of section 27-7 and section 27-12, failure by LVU to make to city when due any of the payments for which provision is made in the contract on or before the second business day following written notice that such payment is due shall constitute a default on the part of LVU. The rights and remedies of city under this section 27-12 shall be in addition and supplemental to any other rights and remedies of city under this chapter. In the event of any default described in this section 27-12, city shall have the right to recover from LVU any amount then due under the provisions of the applicable contract. In enforcement of any such right of recovery, city may bring any suit, action, or proceeding at law or in equity, including without limitation mandamus, injunction and action for specific performance, as city determines may be necessary or appropriate to enforce any covenant, agreement, or obligation to make any payment for which provision is made in the contract. Upon city withholding and/or suspending deliveries of gas consistent with the provisions of section 27-12, city thereafter shall have the right to (or cause its designee to) remarket such gas for such period of time as city in its sole discretion may determine. In the event city takes all or any of the actions authorized by this section 27-12, LVU shall remain fully liable for payment of all amounts in default and interest thereon, and shall not be relieved of any of its obligations under the contract. If city has withheld and/or suspended deliveries of gas under the provisions of this section 27-12 but has not terminated the contract, and LVU subsequently cures a default under this section 27-12 by: 
(1)  LVU providing payment in full of all amounts then due and payable under the contract; 
(2)  LVU (or its guarantor) providing adequate assurance of performance with an adequate assurance deposit amount equal to the adequate assurance valuation amount; and 
(3)  LVU (or its guarantor) agreeing to maintain adequate assurance of performance for the remaining term of the contract with an adequate assurance deposit amount equal to the adequate assurance valuation amount, city shall, within three (3) months of city receiving notice from LVU of such default under this section 27-12 being cured, either: 
(a)  Reinstate such gas deliveries to such LVU; or 
(b)  Exercise its right to terminate and liquidate the transactions under such LVU's contract (and terminate the relevant contract) in the manner provided in section 27-12. 
(Ord. No. 2928, 7-27-09) 
Sec. 27-13. - Force majeure. 
    Except with regard to a party's obligation to make payment(s) due under section 27-10 and/or section 27-12 and to pay imbalance charges due under section 27-8, neither party shall be liable to the other for failure to perform an obligation pursuant to section 27-5, to the extent such failure was caused by force majeure. The term "force majeure" as employed herein means any cause not reasonably within the control of the party claiming suspension, as further defined in section 27-13. 
Force majeure shall include, but shall not be limited to, the following: 
(1)  Physical events such as acts of God, landslides, lightning, earthquakes, fires, storms or storm warnings, such as hurricanes, which result in evacuation of the affected area, floods, washouts, quick sand, explosions, breakage or accident or necessity of repairs to machinery or equipment or lines of pipe; 
(2)  Weather-related events affecting an entire geographic region, such as low temperatures which cause freezing or failure of wells or lines of pipe; 
(3)  Interruption and/or curtailment of firm transportation and/or storage by transporters and of non-firm transportation or storage where firm service is not available; 
(4)  Acts of others such as strikes, lockouts or other industrial disturbances, riots, sabotage, insurrections or wars, or acts of terror; and 
(5)  Governmental actions such as necessity for compliance with any court order, law, statute, ordinance, regulation, or policy having the effect of law promulgated by a governmental authority having jurisdiction. City and LVU shall make reasonable efforts to avoid the adverse impacts of a force majeure and to resolve the event or occurrence once it has occurred in order to resume performance. 
Neither party to a contract shall be entitled to the benefit of the provisions of force majeure to the extent performance is affected by any or all of the following circumstances: 
(1)  The curtailment of interruptible or secondary firm transportation unless primary, in-path, firm transportation is also curtailed, or unless firm transportation service is not available from the affected transporter; or 
(2)  The party claiming excuse failed to remedy the condition and to resume the performance of such covenants or obligations with reasonable dispatch; or 
(3)  Economic hardship, to include, without limitation, city's ability to sell gas at a higher or more advantageous price than the ordinance price, LVU's ability to purchase gas at a lower or more advantageous price than the ordinance price, or a regulatory agency disallowing, in whole or in part, the pass through of costs resulting from the contract; or 
(4)  The loss of LVU's market(s) or LVU's inability to use gas purchased under the contract, except, in either case, as provided in section 27-13; or 
(5)  The loss or failure of city's gas supply or depletion of reserves, except, in either case, as provided in section 27-13; or 
(6)  Breakage or accident or necessity of repairs to machinery within LVU's facilities, unless such incident is the result of other events listed in section 27-13. The party claiming force majeure shall not in any event be excused from its responsibility for imbalance charges. 
Notwithstanding anything to the contrary herein, the parties agree that the settlement of strikes, lockouts or other industrial disturbances shall be within the sole discretion of the party experiencing such disturbance. 
The party whose performance is prevented by force majeure must provide notice to the other party. Initial notice may be given orally; however, written notice with reasonably full particulars of the event or occurrence is required as soon as reasonably possible. Upon providing written notice of force majeure to the other party, the affected party will be relieved of its obligation, from the onset of the force majeure event, to make or accept delivery of gas, as applicable, to the extent and for the duration of force majeure, and neither party shall be deemed to have failed in such obligations to the other during such occurrence or event. 
In claiming a force majeure event under this chapter, city shall not discriminate against an LVU as compared to other LVUs, and unless otherwise agreed to by LVU with respect to a force majeure event under its contract, will apply available resources and facilities to the delivery of gas to such LVU and the delivery of gas to other LVUs on at least a pro rata basis. 
The party not claiming force majeure will have the right, upon forty-five-days' notice to the party claiming force majeure (or such other notice period as agreed to by the parties), to terminate its obligations under its contract prior to the end of the delivery period without liability to either party under section 27-7 in the event of a continuing force majeure event lasting longer than one hundred eighty (180) consecutive days; provided, however, with respect to any contract quantity to be delivered and received under the contract through the date of termination under this section 27-13, the parties shall pay all amounts owed there under and all other applicable charges relating to gas service under the contract (including any amounts owed under section 27-7). Further, LVU shall be responsible to reimburse city for all applicable transportation fees and charges paid or to be paid by city for the right to transport the originally agreed contract quantity to LVU's delivery point as provided for under capacity charges under Schedule 2 at the end of this chapter. 
(Ord. No. 2928, 7-27-09) 
Sec. 27-14. - Term. 
    Each contract shall remain in effect until the expiration of the latest delivery period as set forth under the respective local services agreement; provided, however, any contract may be terminated as of an early termination date in accordance with the terms and conditions under section 27-12. Further, LVU shall have the right to terminate its obligations under this contract in accordance with the provisions of section 27-5 and either party shall have the right to terminate its obligations under this contract in accordance with the provisions of section 27-8. The rights of either party to a contract pursuant to part 11 of its local services agreement, section 27-12, section 27-15, and the obligations to make all accrued payments hereunder shall survive the termination of the contract. 
(Ord. No. 2928, 7-27-09) 
Sec. 27-15. - Limitations. 
    For breach of any provision for which an express remedy or measure of damages is provided, such express remedy or measure of damages shall be the sole and exclusive remedy. A party's liability under a contract shall be limited as set forth in such provision, and all other remedies or damages at law or in equity are waived. If no remedy or measure of damages is expressly provided for under a contract, a party's liability under a contract shall be limited to direct actual damages only. Such direct actual damages shall be the sole and exclusive remedy, and all other remedies or damages at law or in equity are waived. Unless expressly herein provided, neither party under a contract shall be liable for consequential, incidental, punitive, exemplary or indirect damages, lost profits or other business interruption damages, by statute, in tort or contract, under any indemnity provision or otherwise. It is the intent of the parties to a contract that the limitations herein imposed on remedies and the measure of damages be without regard to the cause or causes related thereto, including the negligence of any party, whether such negligence be sole, joint or concurrent, or active or passive. To the extent any damages required to be paid hereunder are liquidated, the parties to a contract acknowledge that the damages are difficult or impossible to determine, or otherwise obtaining an adequate remedy is inconvenient, and the damages calculated hereunder constitute a reasonable approximation of the harm or loss. 
(Ord. No. 2928, 7-27-09) 
Sec. 27-16. - Market disruption and price correction. 
    If a market disruption event has occurred with respect to the index price, then the replacement price shall be determined in accordance with the market disruption procedures set forth in the 1992 ISDA master agreement (multicurrency - cross border) subject to and governed by the 2000 ISDA definitions and the 2005 ISDA commodity derivatives definitions as may be amended, supplemented, updated and restated from time to time (collectively, the "definitions") as if the following elections had been made: 
(1)  The "market disruption events" specified in section 27-8 of the commodity definitions shall apply, except as otherwise specifically provided in the relevant confirmation; 
(2)  "Additional market disruption events" shall apply only if so specified in the relevant confirmation; and 
(3)  The following "disruption fallbacks" specified in section 27-8 of the commodity definitions shall apply in the following order, except as otherwise provided for in the relevant confirmation: 
(a)  Fallback reference price; 
(b)  Negotiated fallback; 
(c)  Delayed publication or announcement; 
(d)  Fallback reference dealers; and 
(e)  No fault termination. 
If a market disruption event has occurred with respect to the spot price, the parties shall negotiate in good faith to agree on a replacement price (or a method for determining the price at issue), and if the parties have not so agreed on or before the fourteenth (14 th ) business day following the first trading day on which the market disruption event occurred or existed, then the replacement price shall be determined by the majority of a panel of three independent dealers in the gas market or other recognized experts in the field of pricing natural gas. The parties shall each select one (1) dealer or other expert and the two (2) dealers or other experts selected by the parties shall mutually agree on the third dealer or expert. 
For purposes of determining the relevant prices for any day, if the index price or the spot price published is corrected no later than thirty (30) days after the original publication and the correction is published or announced by the person responsible for that publication or announcement, either party may notify the other party (1) of that correction, and (2) the amount (if any) that is payable as a result of that correction. If a party gives notice that an amount is so payable, the party that originally either received or retained such amount will, not later than three (3) business days after the effectiveness of that notice, pay, subject to any applicable conditions precedent, to the other party that amount, together with interest at the prime rate of interest published under "Money Rates" by the Wall Street Journal for the period from and including the day on which payment originally was (or was not) made to but excluding the day of payment of the refund or payment resulting from that correction. 
(Ord. No. 2928, 7-27-09) 
Sec. 27-17. - No immunity claim. 
    City warrants and covenants that, with respect to its contractual obligations under the contract, it will not claim immunity on the grounds of sovereignty or similar grounds with respect to itself or the assets of the LVU ordinance utility fund from: 
(1)  Suit; 
(2)  Jurisdiction of court; or 
(3)  Execution or enforcement of judgment. 
(Ord. No. 2928, 7-27-09) 
Sec. 27-18. - Prior ordinances. 
    All ordinances and/or parts of ordinances in conflict herewith are hereby repealed. 
(Ord. No. 2928, 7-27-09) 
Sec. 27-19. - Severability. 
    If any section, subsection, sentence, clause, phrase or portion of this ordinance shall for any reason be held invalid or unconstitutional by any court of competent jurisdiction, such portion shall be deemed a separate, distinct and independent provision and such holding shall not affect the validity of the remaining portions there under. 
(Ord. No. 2928, 7-27-09) 
Sec. 27-20. - Amendments or supplements to ordinance. 
    In accordance with the provisions of Louisiana law, city may from time to time amend or supplement this chapter and the corresponding provisions of the Code of Ordinances of the City of Gonzales. Provided, however, such amendment or supplement to this chapter and the corresponding provisions of the Code of Ordinances of the City of Gonzales shall not be enforceable by city against an LVU which has executed a local services agreement prior to the effective date of such amendment/supplement, unless such LVU provides its written consent to such amendment or supplement; provided, however, that any adjustments to LVU discount and ordinance price in accordance with the provisions of Schedule 2 at the end of this chapter under the heading "Adjustments to LVU Discount and Ordinance Price" shall not require any consent by LVU. City shall provide notice to LVU of any amendment/supplement to this chapter at least ten (10) days prior to the effective date thereof. 
(Ord. No. 2928, 7-27-09) 
Sec. 27-21. - Enactment and authorization. 
    Be it ordained by the mayor and city council of the City of Gonzales, Louisiana, that the provisions of this chapter shall become and be made a party of the Code of Ordinances of the City of Gonzales, Louisiana, and the sections of this chapter may be renumbered to accomplish this intention. 
The mayor of the City of Gonzales is hereby authorized to enter into one (1) or more local services agreements with an LVU as provided in this chapter and to approve any amendments as provided in section 27-20. Other documents related to the LVU program, including but not limited to, natural gas supply agreements, gas remarketing agreements, contracts relating to the management and transportation of gas, and contracts relating to the management of the financial affairs of LVU program, may be executed by the mayor of the City of Gonzales only after the adoption of a resolution of the city council authorizing such action. 
(Ord. No. 2928, 7-27-09)
